intro: Fumaria eximia, commonly known as the yellow glory-of-the-snow, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Fumaria eximia is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the early spring floral display.
